content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: ARM
      operator: non_empty
    - name: ARM
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $ta_arm
Operations:
  - domain: TA
    id: $ta_arm
    name: ARM
    operator: distinct
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.225
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When study does not use multi-stage arm assignments and ARMCD is populated,
  ARMCD must be present in TA.ARMCD. This rule has been executed to identify all cases
  when ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD and therefore acknowledges that false positives
  may be recorded when multi-stage arm assignments are in use.
Outcome:
  Message: ARM is not present in TA.ARM
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '225'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: ARM and ARMCD values in DM and TA must coincide (ARM
                  and ARMCD are defined as the planned Trial Arms in TA, and the planned
                  Arms are then applied to subjects in DM).
                Document: IG v3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 7.3.3.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DM

json.Description: When study does not use multi-stage arm assignments and ARMCD is populated, ARMCD must be present in TA.ARMCD. This rule has been executed to identify all cases when ARMCD is not present in TA.ARMCD and therefore acknowledges that false positives may be recorded when multi-stage arm assignments are in use.

Outcome.Message: ARM is not present in TA.ARM

Citations.Cited_Guidance: ARM and ARMCD values in DM and TA must coincide (ARM and ARMCD are defined as the planned Trial Arms in TA, and the planned Arms are then applied to subjects in DM).
